citations.narrative:
The records maintained to disclose the acquisition information for the breeder monkeys are out of date. The records
reviewed in the breeder notebook only contain acquisition records for three of the currently 26 adult monkeys housed in
the monkey building. Accurate acquisition records for the animals on hand are necessary to allow for identification and
medical/legal tracing. The facility shall make and maintain records that fully and correctly disclose the following
information for all adult monkeys currently in the facility's possession: name and address from whom the monkey was
acquired, USDA license number of the person or their driver's license number/state and vehicle license number/state,
date of acquisition and the species of monkey. Correct by 10/12/24.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Multiple items within the marmoset and tamarin enclosures in the monkey building are in need of cleaning. This includes
items such as the PVC shelf tubes, the fabric cubes and the enrichment mirrors. The enclosures themselves are clean.
The items were noted to be dirty in multiple enclosures. Brown smeared residue was noted on the tubes and cubes. The
mirrors were dirty such that a monkey could no longer see its image in the mirror. Regular cleaning is necessary to
prevent an excessive accumulation of wastes, to prevent the nonhuman primates from becoming soiled and to reduce
disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. The hard surfaces must be spot-cleaned daily. Other items such as perches
and shelves must be kept clean and replaced when worn. Correct by 9/16/24.

The two enclosures housing chinchillas (three and two animals) that are nearest the door of the small mammal room are
in need of cleaning. The enclosures themselves and items within the enclosures such as an exercise wheel and shelves
are dirty with dark brown grime and an excess of fecal pellets are present. One of the chinchillas was noted sitting on the
surface of the dirty exercise wheel. Excreta must be removed from the enclosures to prevent contamination of the animals
contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. Correct by 9/14/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and two facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The records maintained to disclose the acquisition information for the breeder monkeys are out of date. The records 
reviewed in the breeder notebook only contain acquisition records for three of the currently 26 adult monkeys housed in 
the monkey building. Accurate acquisition records for the animals on hand are necessary to allow for identification and 
medical/legal tracing. The facility shall make and maintain records that fully and correctly disclose the following 
information for all adult monkeys currently in the facility's possession: name and address from whom the monkey was 
acquired, USDA license number of the person or their driver's license number/state and vehicle license number/state, 
date of acquisition and the species of monkey. Correct by 10/12/24. 
3.84(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Multiple items within the marmoset and tamarin enclosures in the monkey building are in need of cleaning. This includes 
items such as the PVC shelf tubes, the fabric cubes and the enrichment mirrors. The enclosures themselves are clean. 
The items were noted to be dirty in multiple enclosures. Brown smeared residue was noted on the tubes and cubes. The 
mirrors were dirty such that a monkey could no longer see its image in the mirror. Regular cleaning is necessary to 
prevent an excessive accumulation of wastes, to prevent the nonhuman primates from becoming soiled and to reduce 
disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. The hard surfaces must be spot-cleaned daily. Other items such as perches 
and shelves must be kept clean and replaced when worn. Correct by 9/16/24. 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
The two enclosures housing chinchillas (three and two animals) that are nearest the door of the small mammal room are 
in need of cleaning. The enclosures themselves and items within the enclosures such as an exercise wheel and shelves 
are dirty with dark brown grime and an excess of fecal pellets are present. One of the chinchillas was noted sitting on the 
surface of the dirty exercise wheel. Excreta must be removed from the enclosures to prevent contamination of the animals 
contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. Correct by 9/14/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and two facility representatives.
